text: I always found this battle theme particularly memorable with its low keys and powerful beat. This really was a solid PS1 RPG, but it seems to be mostly forgotten now. I wonder what the developer Genki is up to now.
author: SupraDarky

text: SupraDarky  I replayed the entire demo so many times... What a great theme, that forest was very scary for me back in times because of the music. Thanks for the upload!
author: Robod

text: SupraDarky Can't remember how many times me and one of my best friends have played through this game. And every time I create the exact same monster as my leader =D A white Pegasus! (At least the closest you can get to it xD)
author: Raghnal

text: SupraDarky Hi, just a little nitpick, I think you have spelt the last name of the composer wrong, can you fix that? :)
author: Joachim Ruud

text: One of the worst things they did for the sequel was remove this theme, they got so much stuff right with the first one that they ended up getting rid of facepalm and to think at the time critics panned the first one and gave the second a great review... idiots.
author: Johnny Deep

text: That beat is so sick and catchy! Great battle-theme
author: Furryratchet

text:
I hated the end game forests. This game is still one of my favourite RPGs. I've never played the second one but from what I've heard it's shit.

Maybe one day I can hunt down and find me a physical copy of jade cocoon again and play it like I used to.

This game is kind of janky on my 3ds. It's playable but the sound lags.
author: Aljam

text: Battle hard friends to this funky yet cool tune!
author: Azure Alufei

text: Sometimes I feel that I played Playstation Magazine demo of Jade Cocoon about as much as full game. I even used pencil&notebook combo to make a spreadsheet for combining minions in Beetle Forest. Good times.
author: Mad Markizen

text: This theme is what i remember most about the game :)
author: Redfoxe

text: Really glad to see you still uploading man! Used your channel to host a "guess that video game song" contest at a local comic convention and it was awesome! So many people loved it and almost 100 people participated!
author: GGBDK

text: not many people played this back in the day.  Very interesting game.  Pocket Monsters for ps1 pretty much. :D
author: LionHeartXII

text: Love this game
author: Wade Dewell

text:
Wow Supra, really cool to see you upload music from Jade Cocoon! 
My uncle gave it to me when I was a kid saying "It's kinda like Pokemon..." and I loved every bit of it.
Even then I couldn't find anybody who knew it. I actually beat it again for the first time since I was a kid this year.
Also cool to see you uploaded The Blue Cocoon Master. Now we need Syrus Village.
author: Meir

text:
I'm probably the only one in the world who recites segments of "X Gon' Give it to Ya," to this very rhythm.




Sucks to be everyone else!
author: Madman Asa

text:
First game was basic but solid, loved the fusion meccanic and you could also fight the monsters yourself instead of relying only on your monsters.
The sequel was kinda "eh" because they changed the battle meccanics ( basically instead of having every monster being capable of attacking normally and to use special skills they were limited to the special skills that always consume mana and only the fire type had attack skills ) sooooo they kind of disappeared after JC2.......
author: Realmidboss

text: This game still remains underground and alluring, super cool post!
author: 16bitakira

text: dat box art tho
author: Jay DiNItto

text: such an underrated game. the art direction was from Hayao Miyazaki
author: BioPhoenix

text: Actually it was Katsuya Kondo, the person who did character designs for a number of Miyazaki movies.
author: Arc13

text: maybe i should have said Studio Ghibli but either way same connection
author: BioPhoenix

text: I liked this game mainly for realism, tribes and evolution mixing. Probably why i consider this my favorite Turn based RPG ever made.. thought it also was the first i played on PS1 as a demo haha : D
